profileText: A Representative from Connecticut; born in Norwich, Conn., December 26, 1754; pursued academic studies; was graduated from Yale College in 1775; served in the Revolutionary Army, first in the Lexington alarm in April 1775 and later with the Third and First Connecticut Regiments; brigadier general, United States Army, July 19, 1798, when war with France was threatened; honorably discharged June 15, 1800; elected as a Federalist to the Eleventh Congress to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of Samuel W. Dana and served from October 11, 1810, to March 3, 1811; elected to the Fifteenth Congress (March 4, 1817-March 3, 1819); died in Norwich, Conn., June 17, 1834; interment in Old Colony Cemetery.

note.content: Elected to fill vacancy caused by resignation of Samuel W. Dana, and took his seat December 3, 1810.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Huntington, Ebenezer. Letters written by Ebenezer Huntington during the American Revolution. New York: Printed for C.F. Heartman, [1915].

researchRecord.name: In the Peter Force Collection, 1778-1783, 2 items.
In the Jedediah Huntington Papers, 1758-1814, 1 box.
ca. 1737-1838, 136 pieces.
researchRecord.description: The papers contain letters from Ebenezer Huntington to Jabez Huntington and Andrew Huntington describing his experience in the Revolutionary War and his political and social activities from 1810-1830s. An unpublished finding aid is available in the library.

researchRecord.name: 1793, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A power of attorney given by Ebenezer Huntington to John Kean, giving John Kean the power to receive a stock dividend now due Ebenezer Huntington. The power of attorney was witnesses by Ebenezer Huntington's brother, Samuel Huntington.

researchRecord.name: 1810-1813. 40 documents as an adjutant general of the Connecticut militia.
researchRecord.description: Four additional documents concern Revolution and business matters. Index in repository.

researchRecord.name: 1 undated letter in the Thomas C. Bright autograph collection.
researchRecord.description: To General Clinton reporting troop movement and the burning of Robert Livingston's house. Finding aid in repository.

researchRecord.name: In the Roger Wolcott Autograph Collection, 1728-1878, 1 narrow box and 1 oversize box.
1 letter (June 6, 1779) in the Andrew Huntington papers. 4 letters.
researchRecord.description: From Tiverton, describing living conditions, poverty of inhabitants, and scarcity of bread. Finding aid in repository. Restricted.
